States like Tennessee that refuse to expand Medicaid are keeping hundreds of thousands of their own people from getting coverage and repealing this landmark health care law would threaten health care insurance for millions of Americans.

The Commonwealth Fund report released today confirms what we’ve known for years: Medicaid expansion under the ACA helped insure millions more people. The significant increases in coverage among African Americans exemplifies this. https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/the-health-202/2020/01/16/the-health-202-obamacare-improved-but-didn-t-fix-the-uninsured-gap-between-black-and-white-americans/5e1f473b88e0fa2262dcdef0/ …

This War Powers Resolution is necessary to prevent the president’s further disregard of Congress’ constitutional role and limits the president’s military actions in Iran without Congress’ express authorization. https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-concurrent-resolution/83/text …

As a co-sponsor of the War Powers Resolution, I will vote for the bill later today. The current Authorization for Use of Military Force (AUMF) is outdated and in no way applies to military action against Iran.

But the president’s misguided actions have sped up those capabilities, made America less safe, and left us with less influence in the most dangerous region at a critical time. America’s leadership is needed more than ever, but never before has our leadership been so questioned.
Despite the president’s claims, the Iran Nuclear Agreement was working before he withdrew the U.S. from the deal. It delayed Iran’s nuclear capabilities for years.

Instead of working to restore peace, the president doubled down on his dangerous rhetoric and baseless claims. This only heightens tensions in the Middle East and serves to divide – not unite – Americans.

We are all grateful that there were no casualties stemming from Iranian missile attacks yesterday. However, the president’s remarks did nothing to reduce tensions with Iran, and may have only made the situation more dangerous.
